markdownRemark.html:
At Sāvatthī.

“Mendicants, I will teach you the diversity of elements. And what is the diversity of elements? The sight element, the sound element, the smell element, the taste element, the touch element, and the thought element. This is called the diversity of elements.”

SN.14.7. Saññānānattasutta (“Diversity of Perceptions”)

children.value:
“Mendicants, I will teach you the diversity of elements.
And what is the diversity of elements?
The sight element, the sound element, the smell element, the taste element, the touch element, and the thought element.
This is called the diversity of elements.”
